thread.title: Lewis Moody lists his house on Airbnb for the World Cup
thread.title_full: Lewis Moody lists his house on Airbnb for the World Cup | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Pemberton For Mailonline
title: Lewis Moody lists his house on Airbnb for the World Cup
text:
63 shares 6
View
comments
It's no surprise that this rental property has rugby posts in the back garden.
Former World Cup-winning rugby player Lewis Moody is allowing Airbnb users a unique chance to stay in his Wiltshire house during the World Cup - for a mere £150-a-night.
What's more, as he hands over the keys to his spacious four-bedroom family home, the sports star will even give tenants a once-in-a-lifetime private rugby lesson.
The World Cup-winning rugby player has placed his family home on rental site Airbnb - for a mere £150 a night
As he hands over the keys to his spacious four-bedroom family home, the sporting star will even give a once-in-a-lifetime private rugby lesson
Guests will be allowed to see behind the lines, into the world of the former England captain, during the World Cup period
Lewis Moody pictured in 2011 at Pennyhill Park training centre in Surrey. The star says the World Cup will be an 'amazing experience'
Boasting two Queen bedrooms, a double and a twin bedroom, one en-suite bathroom and two bathrooms with walk-in showers
The mansion is located close to Bath Rugby’s official stadium, The Recreation Ground, perfect for fans wanting to witness some sporting action before retiring to the English rugby union player's home.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 2 Next Plane carrying former England rugby captain Lewis Moody... From staying in a 70cm-wide pod in Berlin to bedding down in... New chapter for AirBnB: The quaint Scottish bookshop... Room with a Grand Prix view! Malaysia's Sepang Circuit... Share this article Share 'The World Cup is going to be an amazing experience for competitors and spectators alike and I’m keen to share it with as many people as possible – and what better way than to open up my own home?!' Moody wrote on the listing .
Boasting two queen bedrooms, a double and a twin bedroom, one en-suite bathroom and two bathrooms with walk-in showers, all areas of Moody's luxurious property, apart from a locked office, will be accessible.
Tenants can enjoy whipping up a meal in the the spacious kitchen area, which has an island breakfast bar for an early morning bite

The four bedrooms are described as being light and spacious with a natural, comfortable feel throughout
The spacious family home is situated in the historic market town of Bradford on Avon and its garden even comes complete with rugby posts and plenty of balls for kicking practice
The four-bedroom, three-bathroom house is located near Bath Rugby’s stadium, The Recreation Ground
MOODY'S HOUSE RULES No pets No Welsh or All Blacks shirts Any chanting of the Haka will not be tolerated No parties (unless England win the World Cup, in which case give me a call!) Compulsory singing of ‘God Save The Queen’ at 8am every morning Of course rugby fans will be able to practise their skills in the large garden at the rear of the property, which includes a decked area with garden furniture.
For those who have worked up a hearty appetite, the large conservatory has a six-seat dining table overlooking the spacious grounds.
Like most Airbnb rentals, the property comes with rules such as no pets or parties.
However unlike other houses, Moody's home also comes with a ban of wearing Welsh or All Blacks shirts and chanting of the Haka will not be tolerated.
Compulsory singing of ‘God Save The Queen’ at 8am every morning is also encouraged, as is a phone call to the England star if England win the World Cup.
Perfectly situated, the house is a five-minute walk from Bradford on Avon train station and about two miles from Avoncliff station.
Since he announced his retirement in 2011, the former captain turned coach has founded the Lewis Moody Foundation, which provides wishes for terminally ill children, and all proceeds from the rental will be donated to this trust.
For those who have worked up a hearty appetite, the large conservatory has a six-seat dining table overlooking the spacious grounds
House rules include no Welsh or Black shirts, no chanting of the Haka and singing of the national anthem at 8am
Of course rugby fans will be able to practise their skills in the large garden at the rear of the property, which includes a decked area with garden furniture
All areas of Moody's luxurious property, apart from a locked office, will be accessible to the tenants of the property
